intro: Christella boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin Islands Christella, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands in the Pacific Ocean. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
